scenario: I'm struggling to understand a concept in my math class. What should I do?
options: Ask my teacher for help
Look for online resources or tutorials
Give up and accept that I'll never understand it
Ask my classmates for the answers
Ignore the concept and hope it doesn't come up on the test

scenario: I have a lot of homework to do and not enough time. What should I do?
options: Prioritize my assignments and work on them one by one
Ask my teacher for an extension
Procrastinate and hope the work magically gets done
Copy someone else's homework
Give up and not do any of the assignments

scenario: I'm feeling overwhelmed with studying for multiple exams. What should I do?
options: Create a study schedule and break down the material into manageable chunks
Take breaks and engage in stress-relieving activities
Cram all night without any breaks
Cheating on the exams
Drop out of school

scenario: I'm struggling to stay focused while studying. What should I do?
options: Find a quiet and distraction-free environment to study
Use study techniques like the Pomodoro Technique
Multitask and study while watching TV
Ask someone else to do the studying for me
Give up and accept that I can't concentrate

scenario: I'm having trouble remembering information for a test. What should I do?
options: Use mnemonic devices or memory techniques to aid in remembering
Review the material multiple times
Drink alcohol to relax and forget about the test
Ask someone else to take the test for me
Give up and accept that I'll fail the test

scenario: I'm struggling to write an essay for my English class. What should I do?
options: Create an outline and break down the essay into smaller sections
Seek feedback from my teacher or classmates
Plagiarize someone else's work
Avoid writing the essay altogether
Submit a blank piece of paper

scenario: I'm feeling unmotivated to study. What should I do?
options: Set specific goals and rewards for completing tasks
Find a study buddy or join a study group
Watch TV instead of studying
Hire someone to do the studying for me
Give up and accept that I won't achieve my academic goals
